parts_of_speech.name: Parts of Speech
parts_of_speech.content:
Parts of Speech

Eight Main Parts:
  • Noun: Person, place, thing (cat, city)
  • Pronoun: Replaces noun (he, she, it)
  • Verb: Action or state (run, is)
  • Adjective: Describes noun (beautiful, tall)
  • Adverb: Describes verb (quickly, very)
  • Preposition: Shows relationship (in, on, at)
  • Conjunction: Connects words (and, but)
  • Interjection: Exclamation (wow, ouch)

tenses.name: Verb Tenses
tenses.content:
English Verb Tenses

Simple Tenses:
  • Present: I walk
  • Past: I walked
  • Future: I will walk
Continuous Tenses:
  • Present: I am walking
  • Past: I was walking
  • Future: I will be walking

main_idea.name: Finding Main Idea
main_idea.content:
Identifying Main Ideas

Tips:
  • Read the first and last sentences of paragraphs
  • Look for repeated words/phrases
  • Ask: 'What is this mostly about?'
  • Supporting details give examples or evidence

inference.name: Making Inferences
inference.content:
Drawing Conclusions

Reading between the lines - understanding what's implied but not directly stated.

Tips:
  • Use context clues
  • Connect to prior knowledge
  • Consider character actions and dialogue
  • Look for cause and effect
